intro: Chasmone andrewsiana, commonly known as the Andrew's chasmone, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically a vibrant red or orange. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and requires protection.
